p: It is so fine for me to be thinking of you 3 together - and that you have gotten adjusted. Please do write me as soon as you can, Alice; For your dear letter, Enid, many thanks.

I was received here much as I expected, but I felt there was something decidedly wrong, when Amama embraced me very warmly - and told me at once what I could do, since she and Maxine dovetailed so perfectly and were going to continue till she left__ We happened to speak of you Alice and that unleased torrents. I immediately told Amama what is what - and to make a long story short - we got into a mess, I

mean are outrageous one__ This is all I need tell you, expecting that Amamma has gone to Kansas City and that I expect never to see her again. I surely made every thing plain - and the fine thing about it all is that Daddy and I are absolutely together this time down to the smalles detail. Daddy told her that I was essentially right, that he was all for me, and that he always would be even if I were wrong!__

So you see the blessing that has come out of it all for me_ Amama had been underhanded and a real sanke in her attitude, while I was with you children, and had tried to win Maxine with flattery against me, - so you can immagine what a lovely feeling there was when I arrived!! But she did not succeed in any detail - so all is fine now - and we are united more than ever.
I feel absolutely cold - and I see clearly. I have not the slightest feeling of pity or affection or anything else when I think of her - as though she ahd never been related to me - just nothing.
So you will probably never entertain her in your home Enid - I expect never to see her again. This certainly is the end. Some day I'll tell you mroe - but there is no use in writing it.
I love all you dear, dear children and I know that you will always love your own devoted.
